metadata.title: CVE-2019-13648 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel through 5.2.1 on the powerpc platform, when hardwaretransactional memory is disabled, a local user can cause a denial ofservice (TM Bad Thing exception and system crash) via a sigreturn() systemcall that sends a crafted signal frame. This affectsarch/powerpc/kernel/signal_32.c and arch/powerpc/kernel/signal_64.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13648` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-60-generic - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-4.15.0-60-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-4.15.0-60-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67
